close.description: The text for a button to close the current page or dialog.

servers_page_title.description: The title of the main page of the application, showing the application's title (Outline). Outline is the product name and can be found in the translation glossary.

servers_menu_item.description: The menu item text to navigate to the list of servers.

feedback_page_title.description: The menu item text and title of a page for a user to send feedback to the app’s developers.

help_page_title.description: The menu item text to navigate to the help section of the app.

about_page_title.description: The title of a page giving details about the app.

licenses_page_title.description: The menu item text to navigate to the page showing all the software licenses used in building the app.

quit.description: The text for a button that quits (closes) the application.

feedback_general.description: This is one of the feedback categories the user can select in a drop-down when sending a feedback to the app developers. This is general feedback, not related to performance or connection issues.

feedback_no_server.description: This is one of the feedback categories the user can select in a drop-down when sending a feedback to the app developers. This is for feedback related to not having a server to connect.

feedback_connection.description: This is one of the feedback categories the user can select in a drop-down when sending a feedback to the app developers. This is for feedback related to problems connecting to a server.

feedback_cannot_add_server.description: This is one of the feedback categories the user can select in a drop-down when sending a feedback to the app developers. This is for feedback related to not being able to import a server into the application.

feedback_performance.description: This is one of the feedback categories the user can select in a drop-down when sending a feedback to the app developers. This is for performance feedback, for example, the speed of connection.

feedback_suggestion.description: This is one of the feedback categories the user can select in a drop-down when sending a feedback to the app developers. This is for suggestions, for example, feature requests.

feedback_input.description: The hint text for a textbox in which the user can type their feedback for the app developers.

email_feedback_input.description: The hint text for a textbox for the user's email address when sending feedback. The email address is not a required field in the form.

feedback_language_disclaimer.message: Please note that our team is only able to answer feedback in English.
feedback_language_disclaimer.description: Text displayed below a feedback form explaining that the support team can only respond to feedback in English.

feedback_privacy.message: Your feedback, your email address (if provided), and additional information referred to in the $START_OF_LINK$Data Collection Policy$END_OF_LINK$ will be sent to the Outline team. Please do not include personal information in your feedback.
feedback_privacy.description: Text appearing above a feedback form explaining the feedback process. Includes a link to the Data Collection Policy as marked by the start and end of link. Outline is the product name and can be found in the translation glossary.

feedback_thanks.message: Thanks for helping us improve! We love hearing from you.
feedback_thanks.description: A message saying thank you after submitting user feedback.

submit.description: The text of a button to submit a form.

submitting.description: Status text showing that a form is progress of being submitted.

about_outline.message: Outline is an open source project created by $JIGSAW$ to provide a safer way for news organizations and journalists to access the internet.$NEW_LINE$$NEW_LINE$ Outline is powered by $SHADOWSOCKS$ and is still an early stage product. You can contribute to the code on $GITHUB$, and follow us on $REDDIT$ and $MEDIUM$ to hear when we expand to more platforms and add new features.
about_outline.description: The contents of the About page of the app. Outline is the product name and can be found in the translation glossary.

learn_more.description: A text button below a message about the application's data collection policies that takes the user to a webpage with more details and information.

privacy.description: The text for a main menu item for the privacy policy and information.

terms.description: The text for a main menu item that takes the user to the applications Terms of Service.

version.description: A line of text on the About page of the application showing the version of the application the user is using.

data_collection.description: The text for a main menu item that takes the user to a webpage explaining the application's data collection policies.

connect_button_label.description: A text button on a particular server to connect to that server

disconnect_button_label.description: A text button on a particular server to disconnect from that server.

undo_button_label.description: A text button in a toast that appears after a server has been forgotten (no longer saved for use by the application)

connected_server_state.description: A status message on a particular server that indicates the server is currently connected and in use.

connecting_server_state.description: A status message on a particular server that indicates the application is currently trying to connect to the labeled server.

disconnected_server_state.description: A status message on a particular server that indicates the server is not connected.

disconnecting_server_state.description: A status message on a particular server that indicates the application is in the process of disconnecting from the labeled server.

reconnecting_server_state.description: A status message on a particular that indicates the application is in the process of reestablishing a connection with the labeled server.

unreachable_server_state.description: A status message on a particular server that indicates the server cannot be connected at all.

server_add.description: Text button for the user to add the access information another server to the application.

server_add_instructions.message: Copy and paste an access key to add a server.
server_add_instructions.description: Instructions on the page explaining how to add a new server to the application's list of servers.

server_access_key_detected.description: A message indicating the application has detected a valid access key to be used to connect to a server.

server_add_access_key.description: The title of the form to add a new server to the application by using a special access key.

server_add_ignore.description: A text button to ignore the valid access key that the application detected.

server_add_invalid.message: $START_LINE$Invalid access key.$END_LINE$Enter a valid access key ($SS_PROTOCOL$) to add a server.
server_add_invalid.description: An error message that indicates the provided access key does not follow the correct format which should begin with ss://. The first part appears on a line by itself.

server_default_name.description: This is the default name for an added server when the type or name is not specified by the access key.

server_default_name_outline.description: The default name for a server when adding a new server to the application. Outline is the product name and can be found in the translation glossary.

server_detected.message: Please confirm that you want to add this server.
server_detected.description: A message to confirm that the user wants to add the given server as a new connection.

server_access_key_label.description: This is the hint text in a textbox that gives a fake example access key (ss://access-key) so the user knows what to paste there.

server_create_your_own.message: Don’t have an access key?$NEW_LINE$Create your own at $START_OF_LINK$our website$END_OF_LINK$.
server_create_your_own.description: A message shown at the bottom of the application when there have been no servers added yet.

server_added.description: The success message shown in a toast after the user adds a particular server.

server_connected.description: The success message shown in a toast after requesting a connection to a particular server.

server_disconnected.description: The status message shown in a toast after disconnecting from a given server.

server_forget.description: The text of an option displayed in a server card's options menu to tell the application to no longer display the server.

server_rename.description: The text of an option displayed in a server card's options menu to tell the application to display a different name for the server.

server_rename_complete.description: The success message after renaming a server in the application.

server_forgotten.description: The success text displayed in a toast message after clicking Forget on a server, meaning the application will no longer show it as an option.

server_forgotten_undo.description: A message shown in a toast when the user clicks Forget for a server to remove it from the application but then clicks Undo to undo that action.

server_add_zero_state_instructions.description: When the user has not yet added a server to the application, the main page shows this message.

server_create_your_own_zero_state.message: Don’t have a server?$NEW_LINE$Create your own at $START_OF_LINK$our website$END_OF_LINK$.
server_create_your_own_zero_state.description: When the user has not yet added a server to the application, the main page shows this message at the bottom.

error_unexpected.message: Sorry, an unexpected error occurred. Quitting and restarting may help. If this happens again, please submit feedback.
error_unexpected.description: An error message shown when the cause is not really known.

error_timeout.message: Something seems to be taking longer than expected. Quitting and restarting may help. If this happens again, please submit feedback.
error_timeout.description: An error message shown when connections are taking too long.

error_invalid_access_key.message: Invalid access key. Please try again, or submit feedback for help.
error_invalid_access_key.description: An error message that indicates the access key provided is not correct.

error_server_incompatible.message: Sorry, this access key is not compatible with this version of Outline.
error_server_incompatible.description: Error message shown when the provided access key isn't compatible the user's version of the application. Outline is the product name and can be found in the translation glossary.

error_server_already_added.description: An error message shown when the user is attempting to add the same server twice.

error_feedback_submission.message: Sorry, we were unable to submit your feedback. Please check that you are connected to the internet and try again.
error_feedback_submission.description: An error message shown when the user is trying to send feedback to the application developers but it is failing.

outline_plugin_error_vpn_permission_not_.message: Outline needs your permission to set up a VPN connection to the server. Please try again, or submit feedback if you need help.
outline_plugin_error_vpn_permission_not_.description: An error message shown when the application does not have the proper operating system permission to create a VPN connection. Outline is the product name and can be found in the translation glossary.

outline_plugin_error_invalid_server_cred.message: It seems like your access key is not valid. If this happens again, please contact your server admin.
outline_plugin_error_invalid_server_cred.description: An error message when the user is trying to connect but has provided an invalid connection key.

outline_plugin_error_udp_forwarding_not_.message: It seems like this server doesn’t support UDP forwarding. If this happens again, please contact your server admin.
outline_plugin_error_udp_forwarding_not_.description: An error message shown when the application tries to connect to a server that does not have the correct UDP forwarding configuration.

outline_plugin_error_server_unreachable.message: We can’t seem to connect to your server. Please check that you are connected to the internet and try again.
outline_plugin_error_server_unreachable.description: An error message shown when the user tries to connect to a server that cannot be reached for some reason.

outline_plugin_error_admin_permissions.message: Outline needs admin permissions in order to run. If you don't have admin permissions, please try again after restarting your Windows computer or ask your system administrator for help.
outline_plugin_error_admin_permissions.description: An error message when the application is not granted administrator permissions.

outline_plugin_error_routing_tables.message: We were not able to configure your routing tables successfully. If this happens again, please contact us.
outline_plugin_error_routing_tables.description: An error message when the application is not able to configure the system for proxying. A button is shown alongside this message to submit feedback.

outline_plugin_error_antivirus.message: It seems like your antivirus software is preventing us from successfully connecting.
outline_plugin_error_antivirus.description: An error message when the application encounters antivirus software that prevents it from connecting.

outline_plugin_error_unsupported_routing.message: It seems like another VPN is active. Please disconnect it and try again.
outline_plugin_error_unsupported_routing.description: An error message when the application fails to connect due to another active VPN.

fix_this.description: A text button in a toast that appears when the application fails to connect due to an antivirus; links to a support article.

tips.description: A text button in a dialog box to get helpful information about the topic.

auto_connect_dialog_title.description: The title of a message to the user that tells them Outline will keep connected unless explicitly told to disconnect. Outline is the product name and can be found in the translation glossary.

auto_connect_dialog_detail.message: Unless you disconnect from your Outline server, Outline will automatically connect next time you restart your device.
auto_connect_dialog_detail.description: An explanation of the connection behavior of the app. Outline is the product name and can be found in the translation glossary.

non_system_vpn_warning_title.description: Title of a dialog that advises the user to check their internet browser's VPN connection.

non_system_vpn_warning_detail.message: Most browsers connect automatically with Outline, some do not.
non_system_vpn_warning_detail.description: Further explanation message that the user needs to verify that their browser is connected through Outline. Outline is the product name and can be found in the translation glossary.

get_help.description: Text button in a dialog box to get an in-depth explanation of the topic being communicated.

got_it.description: Button text for the user to confirm they understand the message of a dialog box.

save.description: The text on a button to save application settings.

cancel.description: The text on a button to cancel the current operation.

update_downloaded.message: An updated version of Outline has been downloaded. It will be installed when you restart Outline.
update_downloaded.description: A message shown to the user to notify them about a new downloaded version. Outline is the product name and can be found in the translation glossary.

privacy_title.message: Outline will never collect your personal information
privacy_title.description: The title of a information page about user privacy. Outline is the product name and can be found in the translation glossary.

privacy_text.message: Some technical information is sent if you submit feedback, if there’s an app error or crash, or if your server administrator opts in to share anonymous server usage data.
privacy_text.description: An explanation on the privacy page about when information would be sent to the application developers.
